First time in New Mexico and had no idea what to expect. The Cabin was perfect for a single woman - on a large private property surrounded by other rentals and homes. It was the perfect blend of privacy and security.
The cottontails running around in the morning was a special treat!
Rachel's place was perfect if you need to change directions during your stay, but don't want to be driving for hours to reach your destinations.
The front view out of my window was glorious and the location was convenient to many of the main attractions of Northern New Mexico - Taos, Chimayo, Abiquiu, Los Alamos, Bandolier etc....
I didn't do much sightseeing in Espanola itself but the small towns in the backroads were fun to drive through. I'm sure I missed some small shops and museums but needed to concentrate on the major sights.
The Food King in Espanola was adequate but I wish I had shopped at Sprouts in Santa Fe before I drove up to the Cabin - just more familiar to me.
Loved my stay!!

Most of the hiking spots were SW of Santa Fe so a 20-30 minute drive from the Casita, and we took our dog with us on a hike almost every day. That was the only time the location bothered us, having to take her back home after a hike and rushing back to Santa Fe for dinner or to go do another activity. I have to recommend this place though. It is so nice, and the price was extremely reasonable. We will stay again if we’re ever in Santa Fe again.

We fell in love with the Ranchito!! We had a girls' trip with 5 women and we were all just in awe of how wonderful Misty's Ranchito is. The house was spectacularly decorated, had EVERYTHING you could even dream of needing, and we felt instantly at home and lucky to have found such a lovely home to stay in. There were so many treasured little spots to lounge in and we each had our own spaces for solo time and many places to gather for meals and outdoor hang time. The kitchen was fully stocked with cooking items and spices, coffee, etc. Misty has thought of everything you might need for your stay and it truly felt magical at the Ranchito.
The location is perfect- we enjoyed hiking/running the BLM land and the views were spectacular. We were really close to Santa Fe and other amazing day trips, but we found that we just wanted to get back to hang out at the Ranchito as much as possible.
100% coming back to the Ranchito and highly recommend!
